marketing.hero_title: The canonical repository for your leads
marketing.hero_subtitle: Capture from any source, normalize, dedupe and deliver with full traceability. One endpoint, zero lost leads.
marketing.feature_raw_payload_desc: Every capture keeps the original payload.
marketing.feature_timeline_desc: Append-only audit trail for each lead.
marketing.feature_deliveries_desc: Retries with exponential backoff and DLQ.
marketing.feature_observability_desc: KPIs, failures and source activity in one place.
marketing.faq_a1: Sending the same Idempotency-Key for the same source returns the original capture_id.
marketing.faq_a2: You can replay one or many failed deliveries and the system retries them immediately.
marketing.faq_a3: Each source has a configurable requests-per-minute limit with HTTP 429 on overflow.

hero.title: A single capture point for all your leads
hero.subtitle: API-first platform for reliable lead capture, deduplication and delivery per workspace. Single endpoint, full audit trail, zero lost leads.
hero.bullet3: Reliable delivery with retries and DLQ

problem.title: The problem you already know
problem.intro: When volume grows, serious teams face the same problems:
problem.pain1: Leads scattered across platforms and forms, with no single source of truth
problem.pain2: No visibility: there's no single place to query and audit what happened
problem.pain3: Duplicate leads that pollute CRMs and distort conversion metrics
problem.pain4: Lost leads due to webhook failures, inconsistent routing and fragile integrations
problem.pain5: Every new campaign or landing page requires reconfiguring logic in multiple places
problem.pain6: Each source sends to a different destination, with no standard and no traceability

whatis.title: What is LeadVault
whatis.p1: LeadVault is an API-first platform that acts as a canonical layer for your leads. It centralizes capture, storage and orchestration of leads from forms, automations, webhooks and custom integrations.
whatis.p2: Receives events on a single endpoint, applies idempotency and identity normalization, merges duplicates per workspace, records an append-only audit timeline, and delivers events to destinations with signing, retries and DLQ.

term1.title: Idempotency
term1.desc: The same event sent twice doesn't create a duplicate. The idempotency key ensures a single entry.

term2.title: Append-only audit trail
term2.desc: Immutable history of everything that happened with each lead — where it came from, what changed, where it went.

term3.title: Retry + DLQ
term3.desc: If the destination fails, LeadVault retries automatically. After exhausting attempts, the event goes to the Dead Letter Queue for manual replay.

step1.title: Capture on a single endpoint
step1.desc: Send leads from any source via API or webhook. The raw payload is fully preserved for audit and reprocessing.

step2.title: Normalize and deduplicate per workspace
step2.desc: Identities (email, phone, external_id) are extracted and normalized. Duplicates are detected and merged automatically.

step3.title: Record audit trail and timeline
step3.desc: Every action is recorded in an append-only log: creation, merge, status change, delivery. Nothing is lost.

step4.title: Deliver with retries and DLQ
step4.desc: Fan-out to N destinations with HMAC signing, automatic retries and dead letter queue. Manual or batch replay when needed.

usecase1.title: Marketing Ops
usecase1.desc: Standardize lead capture across landing pages, forms and campaigns. One endpoint for all sources, no reconfiguring logic for each launch.

usecase2.title: Revenue Ops
usecase2.desc: Consistent routing to CRM and enrichment tools. Deduplication ensures each lead enters the pipeline once, with full traceability.

usecase3.title: Engineering
usecase3.desc: Decouple sources and destinations. Eliminate duplicate logic across services. Standardized API with idempotency, no reinventing webhook handling per project.

usecase4.title: Operations
usecase4.desc: Full audit trail, replay of failed deliveries and failure investigation with immutable timeline. Know exactly what happened with each lead.

beta.title: Open Beta: how it works
beta.inc1: Capture endpoint with idempotency and rate limiting
beta.inc2: Automatic deduplication and merge per workspace
beta.inc4: Destinations via webhooks and API integrations
beta.inc5: Automatic retries and Dead Letter Queue (DLQ)
beta.for_desc: Marketing, growth and engineering teams that capture leads from multiple channels and need a reliable central hub with audit trail and guaranteed delivery.
beta.not_desc: If you need a specific native integration already built (e.g., bidirectional sync with a specific CRM) or don't use APIs/webhooks in your operation.

security.title: Security and compliance
security.intro: Security practices applied from platform design:

s1.title: Encryption in transit and at rest
s1.desc: TLS 1.2+ for all connections. Data stored with encryption.

s2.title: HMAC-SHA256 signing
s2.desc: Delivery webhooks signed with secret + timestamp for destination validation.

s3.title: Workspace isolation
s3.desc: Data, sources and destinations are isolated per workspace. Role-based access control (admin, user, reader).

s4.title: Immutable audit log
s4.desc: Append-only record of all actions. It's not possible to alter or delete history.

security.lgpd: Privacy and data protection: LeadVault adopts a privacy-by-design approach. Data is processed and stored with workspace-level access controls and encryption. For specific compliance questions regarding LGPD or privacy regulations, contact our team.

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.a1: It's the process of identifying and unifying duplicate records. LeadVault detects duplicates by email, phone or external_id and merges them automatically, ensuring each lead exists only once in the workspace.
faq.q2: How does LeadVault prevent duplicate leads?
faq.a2: Through idempotency keys per source and identity normalization. If the same event is sent more than once, the idempotency key prevents duplication. Similar identities (email, phone) are detected and unified automatically.
faq.q3: Can I send leads to any CRM or tool?
faq.a3: Yes. LeadVault delivers via webhooks with HMAC signing. Any system that accepts HTTP POST with JSON payload can be configured as a destination — CRM, email marketing, Slack, internal tools or custom APIs.
faq.q4: What happens if the destination goes down?
faq.a4: LeadVault retries automatically with exponential backoff. If all attempts fail, the event is moved to the Dead Letter Queue (DLQ), from which it can be resent manually or in batch when the destination is back.
faq.a5: Each workspace is an isolated environment with its own sources, leads, destinations and members. Data from one workspace is not accessible by another. Ideal for separating clients, projects or environments.
faq.q6: Does LeadVault replace my form or CRM?
faq.a6: No. LeadVault is an intermediary layer. Your forms keep working and your CRM remains the final destination. LeadVault centralizes capture, ensures data quality and delivers reliably.
faq.q7: How do I start using the beta?
faq.a7: Click "Try it now" to create your account. You'll have immediate access to the capture endpoint, deduplication, audit trail and delivery. The documentation includes integration examples for the most common scenarios.
faq.q8: Is there delivery replay and audit?
faq.a8: Yes. Every delivery is recorded with status, attempts and HTTP response. Failed deliveries can be reprocessed individually or in batch. The timeline shows the complete history of each lead, including all delivery attempts.

final.title: Centralize your leads. Eliminate duplicates. Deliver with confidence.
final.subtitle: Open beta. Get started in minutes.
